title: Mobile-Based Online Language Learning Design: Customized Strategies for Small-Scale Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic language proficiency (CEFR A2 or higher)
context.additional_context: In a limited technological environment centered on smartphones, flexible learning activities must be designed considering learners' physical spaces (home/café, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners can complete at least 80% of self-directed learning modules (60 minutes per session, 5 times per week) in a mobile LMS environment.
Learners can exchange peer feedback and complete two collaborative tasks via text/audio-based computer-mediated communication (CMC) without real-time video sessions.
Learners can apply three contextually appropriate language learning strategies (e.g., noise mitigation) in real-world scenarios considering physical constraints of learning spaces.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
